speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: SCENE III. A street.

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: Enter CINNA the poet

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: I dreamt to-night that I did feast with Caesar,

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: And things unlucky charge my fantasy:

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: I have no will to wander forth of doors,

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: Yet something leads me forth.

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: Enter Citizens

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: What is your name?

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Whither are you going?

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Where do you dwell?

speaker: Fourth Citizen
text_entry: Are you a married man or a bachelor?

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Answer every man directly.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Ay, and briefly.

speaker: Fourth Citizen
text_entry: Ay, and wisely.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Ay, and truly, you were best.

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: What is my name? Whither am I going? Where do I

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: dwell? Am I a married man or a bachelor? Then, to

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: answer every man directly and briefly, wisely and

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: truly: wisely I say, I am a bachelor.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: That's as much as to say, they are fools that marry:

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: you'll bear me a bang for that, I fear. Proceed; directly.

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: Directly, I am going to Caesar's funeral.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: As a friend or an enemy?

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: As a friend.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: That matter is answered directly.

speaker: Fourth Citizen
text_entry: For your dwelling,--briefly.

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: Briefly, I dwell by the Capitol.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Your name, sir, truly.

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: Truly, my name is Cinna.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Tear him to pieces; he's a conspirator.

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: I am Cinna the poet, I am Cinna the poet.

speaker: Fourth Citizen
text_entry: Tear him for his bad verses, tear him for his bad verses.

speaker: CINNA THE POET
text_entry: I am not Cinna the conspirator.

speaker: Fourth Citizen
text_entry: It is no matter, his name's Cinna; pluck but his

speaker: Fourth Citizen
text_entry: name out of his heart, and turn him going.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Tear him, tear him! Come, brands ho! fire-brands:

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: to Brutus', to Cassius'; burn all: some to Decius'

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: house, and some to Casca's; some to Ligarius': away, go!

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: Exeunt
